title: Historical Stock Price Performance of eBay Inc during Market Events

content.text: During the dot-com bubble burst from 2000 to 2002, eBay Inc's stock price experienced a significant decline. In March 2000, at the peak of the bubble, eBay's stock reached an all-time high of $59.25 per share. However, as the bubble burst, the stock price plummeted, reaching a low of $5.85 per share in October 2002. This represented a decline of over 90% from its peak. The burst of the dot-com bubble had a severe impact on many technology stocks, including eBay.

During the global financial crisis from 2007 to 2009, eBay Inc's stock price again faced a significant decline. In October 2007, prior to the crisis, eBay's stock traded at around $39 per share. However, as the crisis unfolded, the stock price dropped sharply and reached a low of $9.91 per share in February 2009. This represented a decline of around 75% from its pre-crisis level. The financial crisis had a widespread negative impact on the stock market, and eBay was not immune to the downturn.

The COVID-19 pandemic had a mixed impact on eBay Inc's stock price. Initially, as the pandemic spread globally and uncertainty grew, eBay's stock faced a decline. In February 2020, the stock traded at around $37 per share, but it dropped to a low of $26.02 per share in March 2020. However, as the pandemic progressed, the popularity of e-commerce platforms like eBay increased, leading to a recovery in the stock price. By the end of 2020, eBay's stock had reached around $52 per share. The pandemic's impact on eBay's stock price showcases the dynamic nature of market reactions to global events.

news.headline: EBay stock rises on Q4 earnings beat
news.summary: EBay (EBAY) reported fourth-quarter earnings that topped Wall Street estimates. The e-commerce company reported adjusted earnings per share of $1.07 compared to the $1.03 estimate. Revenue of $2.56 billion was about in line with the expected $2.51 billion. EBay also announced it was raising its dividend and that its board authorized an additional $2 billion worth of stock repurchases. Yahoo Finance's Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton break down the results. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Stephanie Mikulich

news.headline: UPDATE 3-EBay beats earnings estimates on strong U.S. holiday spending
news.summary: E-commerce platform eBay beat market expectations for quarterly revenue and profit on Tuesday, helped by healthy consumer spending during the holiday season and strength in its focus categories such as refurbished goods and auto parts.  EBay's board of directors also authorized an additional $2 billion share repurchase program.  "We started to see our business improve towards the end of November, particularly in the U.S., driven by consumers looking for value to stretch their limited holiday budgets," eBay CFO Stephen Priest said in a post-earnings call.

news.headline: EBay beats earnings estimates on strong U.S. holiday spending
news.summary: EBay's board of directors also authorized an additional $2 billion share repurchase program.  "We started to see our business improve towards the end of November, particularly in the U.S., driven by consumers looking for value to stretch their limited holiday budgets," eBay CFO Stephen Priest said in a post-earnings call.  The upbeat results show that eBay's marketplace, which serves as a hub for buyers and sellers from around the world, is expected to benefit as consumers loosen budgets and spend heavily amid an easing economy.
